## SDQ vs MASC

SDQ vs MASC: An Insightful Comparison for Psychologists As researchers, we often find ourselves in situations that require careful comparison of different psychology tools, such as the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and the Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC). The complex nature of these instruments makes manual harmonisation a daunting task. This is where Harmony comes into play, serving as an aid for psychologists who need to compare SDQ vs MASC. Harmony, an AI-based software, simplifies the process of comparing SDQ and MASC, making harmonisation an effortless procedure. With Harmony, you can easily pair corresponding items throughout the questionnaires notwithstanding the language of the instrument. It provides a percentage match between each item in SDQ and MASC, shedding light on the correlation between items from each tool. Harmony's user-friendly design allows you to either select instruments from its database or drag and drop your own instruments making the comparison of SDQ vs MASC a breeze. Harmony is an invaluable tool for harmonising SDQ vs MASC, thereby increasing research efficiency. It saves researchers from the mundane task of manually comparing items across different tools, giving them more time to focus on what truly matters - interpreting results and providing insights. Whether you are exploring the differences or similarities between SDQ and MASC, Harmony's advanced natural language processing and AI capabilities will definitely provide a helping hand.

## Compare the items in SDQ and MASC

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and MASC into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just MASC into Harmony</a> - compare MASC with other instruments
